csw:Record.dct:abstract: The Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) is a widely used, dimensionless index that is indicative for vegetation density and is defined as NDVI=(NIR-Red)/(NIR+Red) where NIR corresponds to the reflectance in the near infrared bands, and Red to the reflectance in the red bands.
csw:Record.dc:description: The Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) is a widely used, dimensionless index that is indicative for vegetation density and is defined as NDVI=(NIR-Red)/(NIR+Red) where NIR corresponds to the reflectance in the near infrared bands, and Red to the reflectance in the red bands.
csw:Record.dc:source: The NDVI is calculated from global, 10-daily, BRDF normalized, top-of-canopy reflectances derived from seven bands of Sentinel-3/OLCI optical observations. Prior to NDVI calculation, the four narrow RED TOC-r bands and the three narrow NIR TOC-r bands are converted to a broad RED and NIR reflectance by averaging. The NDVI is calculated using the Red and Nir relfectance values while filtering sea pixels, out-of-range and missing input reflectances. When less-than-optimal input reflectances are used, this is indicated as a quality flag.
